Sentencas: This article presents a literature review and new results on experimental and theoretical investigations of the electrochemistry of solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) model anodes, focusing on the nickel/yttria-stabilized zirconia (Ni/YSZ) materials system with operation under H-2/H2O atmospheres.
Titulo: Model anodes and anode models for understanding the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Micropatterned model anodes were used for electrochemical characterization under well-defined operating conditions.
Titulo: Model anodes and anode models for understanding the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Structural and chemical integrity was confirmed by ex situ pre-test and post-test microstructural and chemical analysis.
Titulo: Model anodes and anode models for understanding the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Elementary kinetic models of reaction and transport processes were used to assess reaction pathways and rate-determining steps.
Titulo: Model anodes and anode models for understanding the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The comparison of experimental and simulated electrochemical behaviors of pattern anodes shows quantitative agreement over a wide range of operating conditions (p(H2) = 8 x 10(2) -9 x 10(4)

Sentencas: Furthermore, model anodes exhibit a pronounced dynamics on multiple time scales which is not reproduced in state-of-the-art models and which is also not observed in technical cermet anodes.
Titulo: Model anodes and anode models for understanding the mechanism of hydrogen oxidation in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Potential origin of these effects as well as consequences for further steps in model anode and anode model studies are discussed.
